Package harrypotter.entities.actors

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Entity
      • edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Actor<HPActionInterface>
        • harrypotter.HPActor
          • harrypotter.entities.actors.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntityInterface, HPEntityInterface
    public class Player
extends HPActor
    A very minimal HPActor that the user can control. Its act() method prompts the user to select a command.
    Author:
    ram

    • Constructor Summary

      Player​(Team team, int hitpoints, MessageRenderer m, HPWorld world)
      Constructor for the Player class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void act()
      This method will describe this Player's scene and prompt for user input through the controller to schedule the command.
      void describeScene()
      This method will describe, the this Player's location items carried (if this Player is carrying any) the contents of this Player location (what this Player can see) other than itself

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player​(Team team,
              int hitpoints,
              MessageRenderer m,
              HPWorld world)
        Constructor for the Player class. This constructor will,
        • Initialize the message renderer for the Player
        • Initialize the world for this Player
        • Initialize the Team for this Player
        • Initialize the hit points for this Player
        • Set this Player as a human controlled HPActor
        Parameters:
        team - the Team to which the this Player belongs to
        hitpoints - the hit points of this Player to get started with
        m - MessageRenderer to display messages.
        world - the HPWorld world to which this Player belongs to

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        This method will describe this Player's scene and prompt for user input through the controller to schedule the command.

        This method will only be called if this Player is alive and is not waiting.

        Specified by:
        act in class Actor<HPActionInterface>

      • describeScene

        public void describeScene()
        This method will describe,
        • the this Player's location
        • items carried (if this Player is carrying any)
        • the contents of this Player location (what this Player can see) other than itself

            • The output from this method would be through the MessageRenderer.
